title: Louis Walsh sympathises with Cheryl’s ‘tough time’ as he buries feud
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Louis Walsh has no hard feelings towards his longtime rival Cheryl, whom he has sympathised with in light of her ‘tough time’.

The X Factor: Celebrity judge has been embroiled in a feud with the former Girls Aloud singer for years, stemming from when he briefly managed the popular girl group between 2002 and 2004.

But it seems tensions may have finally simmered – at least on one side – as Louis spoke highly of the Fight For This Love singer.

Speaking to Richard Arnold for Good Morning Britain at the X Factor: Celebrity launch on Wednesday, Louis claimed: ‘I love Cheryl, I think she’s in a really good place.’

He added: ‘I love her now more than I used to. She’s a good person and she’s had a tough time. Now she’s got a baby and I only wish her well.’

Perhaps the ‘tough time’ Louis is referring to is Cheryl’s split from boyfriend Liam Payne last year. The couple dated for two years and share two-year-old son Bear, although they are thought to be parenting amicably.

Liam, 26, has since moved on and is now dating model Maya Henry while Cheryl is believed to be single.

Louis’ got a lot of love for Cheryl (Picture: Getty/Rex/Metro.co.uk)

Louis’ kind comments about Cheryl are a stark contrast to his earlier mocking of her singing talents.

The X Factor judge joked about the possibility of having Cheryl compete in the new celebrity version of the ITV series: ‘You mean as a contestant? She would be good. She could even win it.

‘Cheryl doesn’t mime. It’s called lip-syncing.’

Elsewhere in his chat with Richard, Louis made a cheeky quip about Sharon Osbourne’s cosmetic surgery.

While discussing Sharon’s absence from the X Factor: Celebrity judging panel, Louis joked: ‘I would have loved Sharon Osbourne but she’s getting a new face. It’s supposed to be the best one yet.’

He added: ‘Don’t go to Simon’s [surgeon], go to Sharon’s.’
